channel.title: International CES News
channel.description: Stay up-to-date on the latest developments for 2008 International CES attendees.

item.title: 2010 CES puts spotlight on Digital Imaging Showcase
item.description: 2010 CES to Include ATP, Kodak, Iomega, Tiffen, Wacom and Wynit.

item.title: Living in Digital Times to highlight technology innovations for all ages
item.description: Living in Digital Times, a new spotlight at the 2010 International CES, focuses on technology's impact on consumer lifestyles, from tech-savvy youth to digital moms to seniors.

item.title: Top Intel and MIcrosoft execs to keynote 2010 CES
item.description: Microsoft's Steve Ballmer and Intel's Paul Otellini to speak at world's largest consumer technology tradeshow

item.title: Final Week to Enter i-stage for a Chance at $50,000 and Booth at CES
item.description: Think you've got America's next top gadget, app or service? Prove it by 5 p.m. EDT this Friday, August 14, for a chance at $50,000 in prize money and a free booth at the 2010 International CES.

item.title: Exhibit space still available in EHX@CES show floor area
item.description: New for 2010, EHX@CES is powered by CE Pro to bring the EHX experience of a dedicated custom electronic exhibition to CES.

item.title: CES Brings in Some of the Most Influential Leaders in Consumer Electronics
item.description: Every January, Vegas plays host to the International CES and the 100,000+ attendees and exhibitors that it brings in. However, who exactly is attending CES with buying power?

item.title: The Association Behind the Show Launches New Grass-Roots Movement
item.description: Innovation Movement unites industry professionals, entrepreneurs and all Americans who believe innovation will promote American global leadership and economic recovery and growth.

item.title: Green is the New Black and Other Top Trends for 2010 CES
item.description: Here’s a quick shot at what developments playing out at CES 2010 might emerge as game changers in the years to come.

item.title: To Exhibit or Not to Exhibit During a Recession: Use Numbers to Help You Decide
item.description: CEA Marketing Vice President Susan Littleton shares her thoughts about why exhibiting at tradeshows is valuable during a recession.

item.title: Secure Your Travel Visa Now
item.description: Wait times for a visa interview can be several weeks or more in many countries, especially during peak travel periods.

item.title: CEA to Co-produce the International Forum on Sustainability of Consumer Electronics at SINOCES
item.description: E-waste and sustainability experts convene at China's most important consumer technology event this July.

item.title: Official CES Hotels Now Accepting Reservations for 2010 Show
item.description: The only thing more important than registering for CES is booking hotel accommodations for CES.

item.title: Reach More CE Pros Through the Combined Power of EHX and CES
item.description: Exhibiting opportunities are available at the first annual EHX@CES taking place in conjunction with the 2010 CES.

item.title: Aneesh Chopra, U.S. Chief Technology Officer, to Keynote CEA Line Shows
CEA Line Shows Just Days Away
item.description: If consumer electronics is your business, then register to attend CEA Line Shows, June 10-11.

item.title: Do You Have the Formula for Success on the i-stage?
item.description: i-stage is the proving ground for next-gen technologies – a chance for the hottest up-and-coming products, coolest services and killer applications to show off their selling points and duke it out to become the most promising powerhouse.

item.title: Women and Tech Awards, Panel and Reception at CEA Line Shows, June 11
item.description: Sessions unveil the best tech products for women.

item.title: 2009 SINOCES Hosts International CES' Best of Innovations Product Showcase
item.description: SINOCES attendees get the only opportunity outside the U.S. to see CES Innovations.

item.title: CEA President Says on CNN.com: The Next Generation Won't Have a Bill Gates
item.description: CEA President and CEO Gary Shapiro provides CNN.com commentary on how the government has been rushing to bail out failing companies.

item.title: New Customs Regulation Rule Affects CES Exhibitors
item.description: New U.S. Customs regulation for ocean freight shipped to the U.S. in place for 2010 International CES shipments.
